pr_title: FM2-96: Implement additional fields for observations

timeline.bodyText: We actually shouldn't return null if it's a DrugOrder. I'd just handle it as usual anyways.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Please don't use the org.openmrs.api.OrderService here. Instead, create a FhirOrderDao to get the order from the database. I don't want to depend on the OpenMRS Service API if we can avoid it.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: We should not being doing this. Let the dateCreated (and dateChanged) fields get updated by the system, not by our code.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher I'm not sure I understand this, do you mean like we shouldn't be mapping openmrs fields?
replies.author: jecihjoy

replies.bodyText: I just mean we shouldn't be updating dateCreated and dateUpdated based on values supplied via the FHIR interface. They should basically be read-only fields.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: What happens if there is no effectiveDateTimeType set for this resource? We should actually have a translator here that can handle (at least) effectiveDateTime and effectiveInstant.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher do you mean doing this in something like a ObservationEffectiveDatetimeTranslator?
replies.author: jecihjoy

replies.bodyText: Yes. It's kind of similar to what we had to do with ObservationValueTranslator.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: This should still be "ServiceRequest" since "Order" isn't a valid FHIR object type.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: In this method, it may make sense to differentiate DrugOrders, but in that case have them return a reference to a "MedicationRequest". However, that only makes sense once the MedicationRequest resource is created.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Again, reference should be to a ServiceRequest, not an Order
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: In addition to DateTimeType we should also support InstantType here, which is very similar to DateTimeType, but represents a slightly more precise type.
timeline.author: ibacher
